last_post.content:
Read this?

https://nymag.com/intelligencer/article/ai-artificial-intelligence-chatbots-emily-m-bender.html

It’s a great piece of writing. I agree with a lot of it. I think where I diverge is that in many situations whether we think there is mind behind the bot doesn't matter.

Folks are experimenting with hooking LLMs up to a web browser and ordering taskrabbits, with some success. If Sydney is going babble on about dark fantasies, the problem is not that we might forget who is human, but that it shouldn’t be allowed to direct resources in the real world.

title: Twitter’s $42,000-per-Month API Prices Out Nearly Everyone

last_post.content:
In this piece for #WIRED, @stokel outlines how Twitter and Melon Usk intend to charge $USD 42k per month and upwards to access #research #data via the platform's #API - putting it out of reach of most researchers and #universities

An example of #ChokePointCapitalism (per @docotorow and #RebeccaGiblin #rgibli?

Frankly, I'm surprised at this approach to market. I thought Twitter would have approached the journal publishers instead, and got them to paywall Twitter through their existing university subscriptions.

Happy to announce the release of spaCy 3.5.1!

It introduces 'spancat_singlelabel', support for mypy v1.0, new operators for the dependency matchers, a 'PlainTextCorpusReader', various bug fixes and more!

We recently also added two new resources:

* https://github.com/explosion/projects/tree/v3/benchmarks/span-labeling-datasets bundles various NER & spancat datasets + .spacy convertors

* https://github.com/explosion/projects/tree/v3/benchmarks/ner_embeddings contains all resources to reproduce the results of our "Multi hash embeddings" technical report: https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.09255

Happy weekend!

#MastodonNews Mar 2, 2023

Twitter is a complex system. Complex systems gradually fall apart unless energy is spent finding and fixing problems before they become critical. Musk gutted these activities with predicable results.

@mmasnick on Twitter's slow meltdown...

techdirt: As Twitter Goes Down Yet Again, Report Highlights How Fragile Its Infrastructure Has Become >>> https://www.techdirt.com/2023/03/02/__trashed/

Twitter had a small number of “load bearing” employees... all of them are gone.

#twittermigration

Someone finally did a study based on data from GitHub PRs that measures how it is that teams that do continuous code review (either #pairprogramming or #mobprogramming) are somewhat counterintuitively able to perform so much better than those doing asynchronous code reviews (pull requests). Lotsa queuing theory but it boils down to ensemble programmers having zero interruptions & remaining in a flow state. https://youtu.be/fYFruezJEDs

(Also the psychological safety advantage is huge in my XP ☺️)

Alrighty then…

Another small #WebR #RStats WASM demo.

This one:

— Loads a package ({jsonlite})
— Yanks `mtcars` from the WebR session
— Converts it to #JSON b/c what WebR returns is garbage for JS datavis libraries — and I don't have time rn to write a function to do the transform.
— Passes it to #VegaLite for the datavis.

It take a couple seconds for vis to show up b/c of WebR initialization & remote pkg loading.

https://rud.is/webr-d3-demo/pkgs.html

With @maelle help, 9 of my #rstats pkgs were just archived on CRAN

- getlandsat
- jaod
- mapr
- pubchunks
- rbace
- rbhl
- rcitoid
- rcoreoa
- rplos

Source code for all can still be found at https://github.com/ropensci-archive + /<package name>

This isn't a bad #opensource outcome - it's a normal outcome when a maintainer moves on (me) and new maintainers can not be found - suggesting the code just isn't useful enough to anyone to take over - BUT! the cran archiving may surface someone(s) that will

Automattic, the company behind WordPress, is now co-authoring the ActivityPub plugin for WordPress.

The intent is to make WordPress a "first party Fediverse member" on par with Mastodon, Pleroma, and Pixelfed.

WordPress already powers 43% of all websites—and every one is a potential Fediverse server.

Automattic employee @kraft just confirmed this.

title: Hashtag Accessibility, by Everyone for Everyone - Mark Wyner - Medium

last_post.content:
Every hashtag on every post on every platform should ALWAYS be pascal case (a.k.a. camel case). I made this to illustrate how screenreaders read hashtags depending on whether they are lowercase or pascal case.

It’s a small thing that all of us can do to build a more inclusive, accessible internet for all. Please take the time to use pascal case.

Update:
https://markwyner.medium.com/hashtag-accessibility-by-everyone-for-everyone-298667b2d891

#Accessibility #WebAccessibility #Usability #Readability #Hashtags #SocialNetworking #Blogging #UX

title: Six Centuries of Type & Printing (letterpress and ebook bundle)

last_post.content: Back in 2020, I published Six Centuries of Type & Printing, a concise book – 64 pages – that actually starts centuries before Gutenberg, with Chinese and Korea printing, and then digs into 1450 to 2020 period, covering ~600 years of technological advances. Set in hot-metal type (Monotype Bembo) in North Yorkshire, printed in London, and bound in Germany with a foil-stamped cover & slipcase, I still have copies available for shipping worldwide! https://glog.glennf.com/tiny-type-museum-time-capsule-and-more/six-centuries-letterpress (ebook edition available)

HyperCard is a software application and development kit for Apple Macintosh and Apple IIGS computers. It is among the first successful hypermedia systems predating the World Wide Web. HyperCard combines a flat-file database with a graphical, flexible, user-modifiable interface.

title: COVID survivors at increased risk of long-term gastrointestinal conditions

last_post.content:
From constipation and diarrhea to chronic acid reflux, pancreatitis, and inflammation of the bile ducts, surviving a case of COVID significantly increases the risk of developing a range of gastrointestinal issues.
https://arstechnica.com/science/2023/03/having-covid-ups-risk-of-many-long-term-gut-problems-study-finds/?utm_brand=ars

The sudden collapse of Silicon Valley Bank is sending absolute shockwaves through the tech industry. Nobody is really buying into the narrative that "The risk of contagion is low" - the bottom line is, we don't know. The last 8 years in tech have been really strange, driven by wild monetary policy driving reckless investment decisions even from VC's whom I considered to be fairly conservative. We are due for a wider reckoning. https://www.cnn.com/2023/03/10/investing/svb-bank/index.html

title: Giving the middle finger is a ‘God-given right’, Canadian judge rules

last_post.content:
Giving your neighbour the middle finger may not be polite, but is protected as part of a person’s right to freedom of expression under the Canadian constitution, a judge has ruled.

"To be abundantly clear, it is not a crime to give someone the finger. Flipping the proverbial bird is a God-given, #Charter enshrined right that belongs to every red-blooded Canadian."

#CdnLaw #Canada 🇨🇦

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/mar/10/giving-the-middle-finger-is-a-god-given-right-canada-canadian-judge-rules

Hi friends, I have been working on a service to help get RSS feeds into mastodon, and it's more or less ready for prime time. It lives at:

https://feedsin.space/

Basically, you:

1) create an account by sending a message to @admin with the word "help", and clicking on the link you get back

2) specify the URL to a feed, and a username for the feed

3) your feed lives at ____@feedsin.space, and you can follow it like any other account in the fedi

Blog post here: https://muffinlabs.com/2023/03/09/feedsin-space/

@Gte @Diggory Monaco *was* the default, but like, forever ago. Default is now SF Mono. And I’m pretty sure there was a 10-year-ish-long stretch where the default was Menlo. Nothing wrong with Monaco, though — it’s the sole survivor from the original Macintosh’s lineup of fonts. So using the oldest-school of old-school monospace fonts jibes with your old-school color scheme.

https://apple.fandom.com/wiki/Apple_typography#Fonts_of_the_original_Macintosh

Trolls trying to write the sentence "Nato cannot save Finland" in Finnish failed because the language has two different words for 'save,' with two completely different meanings.

title: BBC will not broadcast Attenborough episode over fear of ‘rightwing backlash’

last_post.content:
For many years, I've been calling the BBC the world's best English-language news broadcaster.

In light of its refusal to air a program because it fears the right wing's response, I can't say that anymore.

Tragic to see an icon of journalistic brilliance destroy its own credibility...

https://www.theguardian.com/media/2023/mar/10/david-attenborough-bbc-wild-isles-episode-rightwing-backlash-fears?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other
